nodes.name: DatasetStructured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

nodes.name: StringToDate
nodes.description: This node converts a string column to date using the given date/time format
nodes.examples:
Format Examples


dd-MM-yy : 31-01-12
dd-MM-yyyy : 31-01-2012
MM-dd-yyyy : 01-31-2012
yyyy-MM-dd : 2012-01-31
yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss : 2012-01-31 23:59:59
yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS : 2012-01-31 23:59:59.999
yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSZ : 2012-01-31 23:59:59.999+0100
EEEEE MMMMM yyyy HH:mm:ss.SSSZ : Saturday November 2012 10:45:42.720+0100

OUTPUT COLUMN NAME: - If user inputs an existing column name, it overrides the column
otherwise it will add a new column.

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Date Example Workflow


This workflows reads in a dataset with time values stored as a string.


It converts it to a new timestamp column.
